intro: Potentilla ruderalis, commonly known as the common cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features compound leaves with five leaflets and produces small, yellow, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Potentilla ruderalis is known for its adaptability and is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize open spaces.
